concise_definition: adj. 苗条的, 瘦削的; v. 变瘦, 减肥

definitions.explanation_en: Having a thin, narrow, or slender build, especially in a way that is considered attractive or healthy.
definitions.explanation_cn: 身材纤细、窄小，通常指一种被认为有吸引力或健康的体型。
definitions.example_en: She has maintained a slim figure through regular exercise and a balanced diet.
definitions.example_cn: 她通过规律锻炼和均衡饮食保持了苗条的身材。

definitions.explanation_en: Small in amount, degree, or probability; barely sufficient or likely.
definitions.explanation_cn: 数量、程度或可能性很小；勉强足够或可能性微弱。
definitions.example_en: There's only a slim chance that the flight will be on time.
definitions.example_cn: 航班准点的可能性微乎其微。

definitions.explanation_en: To reduce one's body size, especially by losing fat, through diet, exercise, or other means.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过节食、锻炼或其他方式减少体重，尤其是减少脂肪。
definitions.example_en: He slimmed down by cutting out sugar and running every morning.
definitions.example_cn: 他通过戒糖和每天晨跑减了肥。

comparison.analysis: “Thin” (瘦的) 是一个更中性、更广泛的词，仅描述身体或物体缺乏厚度，不带有审美判断。它可以用于人、纸张、汤等。而 “slim” 通常用于形容人，带有积极或赞美的含义，强调优雅或健康的瘦。
“Lean” (精瘦的) 强调肌肉发达、脂肪少，常用于描述运动员或健康体态，隐含力量与控制。它比 “slim” 更强调体能和结构，而 “slim” 更侧重外观上的纤细。
“Skinny” (极瘦的) 是口语化表达，常带有贬义或夸张色彩，暗示瘦得过度或不健康。而 “slim” 是中性或褒义词，更正式、更得体，适用于大多数语境。
